org.opentrafficsim.core.value.vfloat.scalar

Class MutableFloatScalar<U extends Unit<U>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Number
      • org.opentrafficsim.core.value.Scalar<U>
        • org.opentrafficsim.core.value.vfloat.scalar.FloatScalar<U>
          • org.opentrafficsim.core.value.vfloat.scalar.MutableFloatScalar<U>
  • Type Parameters:
    U - the unit of the values in the constructor and for display
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, MathFunctions, Value<U>, FloatMathFunctions
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MutableFloatScalar.Abs, MutableFloatScalar.Rel

    public abstract class MutableFloatScalar<U extends Unit<U>>
extends FloatScalar<U>
implements FloatMathFunctions
    MutableFloatScalar.

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void abs()
      Set the value(s) to their absolute value.
      void acos()
      Set the value(s) to the arc cosine of the value(s); the resulting angle is in the range 0.0 through pi.
      void add(FloatScalar.Rel<U> value)
      Add another value to this value.
      void asin()
      Set the value(s) to the arc sine of the value(s); the resulting angle is in the range -pi/2 through pi/2.

      Set the value(s) to the arc tangent of the value(s); the resulting angle is in the range -pi/2 through pi/2.

      Set the value(s) to the(ir) cube root.

      Set the value(s) to the smallest (closest to negative infinity) value(s) that are greater than or equal to the argument and equal to a mathematical integer.

      static MutableFloatScalar.Abs<SIUnit> divide(FloatScalar.Abs<?> left, FloatScalar.Abs<?> right)
      Divide two values; the result is a new instance with a different (existing or generated) SI unit.

      Divide two values; the result is a new instance with a different (existing or generated) SI unit.

      Set the value(s) to Euler's number e raised to the power of the value(s).

      Set the value(s) to Euler's number e raised to the power of the value(s) minus 1 (e^x - 1).
      void floor()
      Set the value(s) to the largest (closest to positive infinity) value(s) that are less than or equal to the argument and equal to a mathematical integer.

      void log1p()
      Set the value(s) to the natural logarithm of the sum of the value(s) and 1.

      Set the value(s) to the closest long to the argument with ties rounding up.

      Set the value(s) to the signum function of the value(s); zero if the argument is zero, 1.0 if the argument is greater than zero, -1.0 if the argument is less than zero.

    • Method Detail

      • immutable

        public abstract FloatScalar<U> immutable()
        Construct an immutable version of this MutableFloatScalar.
        The immutable version is created as a deep copy of this. Delayed copying is not worthwhile for a Scalar.
        Returns:
        FloatScalar<U>; immutable version of this FloatScalar

      • add

        public final void add(FloatScalar.Rel<U> value)
        Add another value to this value. Only Relative values are allowed; adding an absolute value to an absolute value is not allowed. Adding an absolute value to an existing relative value would require the result to become absolute, which is a type change that is impossible. For that operation, use a static method.
        Parameters:
        value - FloatScalar.Rel<U>; the value to add

      • subtract

        public final void subtract(FloatScalar.Rel<U> value)
        Subtract another value from this value. Only relative values are allowed; subtracting an absolute value from a relative value is not allowed. Subtracting an absolute value from an existing absolute value would require the result to become relative, which is a type change that is impossible. For that operation, use a static method.
        Parameters:
        value - FloatScalar.Rel<U>; the value to subtract

      • incrementBy

        protected final FloatScalar<?> incrementBy(FloatScalar<?> increment)
        Increment the stored value by a specified amount.
        Parameters:
        increment - FloatScalar<?>; the amount by which to increment the stored value
        Returns:
        FloatScalar<?>; the modified MutableFloatScalar

      • plus

        @SafeVarargs
public static <U extends Unit<U>> MutableFloatScalar.Abs<U> plus(FloatScalar.Abs<U> valueAbs,
                                                             FloatScalar.Rel<U>... valuesRel)
        Add a number of relative values to an absolute value. Return a new instance of the value. The unit of the return value will be the unit of the first argument. Due to type erasure of generics, the method cannot check whether an array of arguments submitted to the varargs has a mixed-unit content at runtime.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Unit; the unit of the parameters and the result
        Parameters:
        valueAbs - FloatScalar.Abs<U>; the absolute base value
        valuesRel - FloatScalar.Rel<U>...; zero or more relative values to add to the absolute value
        Returns:
        MutableFloatScalar.Abs<U>; the sum of the values as an absolute value

      • plus

        @SafeVarargs
public static <U extends Unit<U>> MutableFloatScalar.Rel<U> plus(U targetUnit,
                                                             FloatScalar.Rel<U>... valuesRel)
        Add a number of relative values. Return a new instance of the value. Due to type erasure of generics, the method cannot check whether an array of arguments submitted to the varargs has a mixed-unit content at runtime.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Unit; the unit of the parameters and the result
        Parameters:
        targetUnit - U; the unit of the sum
        valuesRel - FloatScalar.Rel<U>...; zero or more relative values to add together
        Returns:
        MutableFloatScalar.Rel<U>; the sum of the values as a relative value

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        valueAbs - FloatScalar.Abs<U>; the absolute base value
        valuesRel - FloatScalar.Rel<U>...; zero or more relative values to subtract from the absolute value
        Returns:
        MutableFloatScalar.Abs<U>; the resulting value as an absolute value

      • minus

        @SafeVarargs
public static <U extends Unit<U>> MutableFloatScalar.Rel<U> minus(FloatScalar.Rel<U> valueRel,
                                                              FloatScalar.Rel<U>... valuesRel)
        Subtract a number of relative values from a relative value. Return a new instance of the value. The unit of the value will be the unit of the first argument. Due to type erasure of generics, the method cannot check whether an array of arguments submitted to the varargs has a mixed-unit content at runtime.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Unit; the unit of the parameters and the result
        Parameters:
        valueRel - FloatScalar.Rel<U>; the relative base value
        valuesRel - FloatScalar.Rel<U>...; zero or more relative values to subtract from the first value
        Returns:
        MutableFloatScalar.Rel<U>; the resulting value as a relative value

      • minus

        public static <U extends Unit<U>> MutableFloatScalar.Rel<U> minus(FloatScalar.Abs<U> valueAbs1,
                                                  FloatScalar.Abs<U> valueAbs2)
        Subtract two absolute values. Return a new instance of a relative value of the difference. The unit of the value will be the unit of the first argument.
        Type Parameters:
        U - Unit; the unit of the parameters and the result
        Parameters:
        valueAbs1 - FloatScalar.Abs<U>; value 1
        valueAbs2 - FloatScalar.Abs<U>; value 2
        Returns:
        MutableFloatScalar.Rel<U>; the difference of the two absolute values as a relative value
